intro: Acronia lobata, commonly known as the lobed acronia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Acronia lobata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
